title: 'Mock Taipei': China steps up Taiwan invasion plan; replica war zone triples in size
description: China has significantly expanded its mock Taipei government buildings at the Zhurihe Training Base, tripling its size since 2020. This includes replicas of key institutions and a symbolic tunnel, indicating intensified military preparations and urban warfare drills. Experts view this as refining invasion strategies and psychological warfare against Taiwan, demanding heightened vigilance.

description: A man received a six-year jail term for an attack at musician AP Dhillon's home. Abjeet Kingra, an alleged associate of gangster Lawrence Bishnoi, pleaded guilty. The incident involved gunshots and vehicles set ablaze in Colwood. This sentencing follows Canada's move to list the Bishnoi Gang as a terrorist entity. Authorities continue to seek another suspect in the case.

title: Watch: Illegal mosque on govt land bulldozed in Sambhal; SP says 30-day notice ignored
description: Authorities in Uttar Pradesh’s Sambhal district demolished illegal structures in Rae Buzurg village after a 30-day notice. The buildings, including a madrasa and wedding hall, were built on pond land without authorization. Officials said due process was followed, and no appeals were filed. Drone surveillance was used during the operation, which is part of an ongoing anti-encroachment drive.

title: 'Any misadventure ...': Rajnath flags Pak military build-up in Sir Creek; warns of ‘decisive response’
description: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh blamed Pakistan’s unclear intentions for the unresolved Sir Creek border dispute, warning of strong retaliation against any provocation. Citing Operation Sindoor, he praised India’s military strength in tackling threats, including Pakistan’s failed infiltration attempts. Singh stressed that while India has the power to respond forcefully, its actions remain focused on countering terrorism, not waging war.

Fatty liver disease: Common leg symptom may be an early warning, doctor reveals
description: Fatty liver disease, particularly NAFLD, is a growing global concern largely driven by lifestyle factors. Gastroenterologist Dr. Pradip Vekariya highlights pedal edema, or swollen feet, as a crucial yet often-ignored early warning sign of liver damage. He stresses the importance of early detection through a simple pitting test to prevent the disease's progression and save lives.

description: At the UN, India slammed Pakistan for hypocrisy on human rights and support for terrorism. Indian diplomats rebuked Pakistan’s claims as propaganda, citing its persecution of minorities and recent civilian deaths in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa. India also criticised Pakistan’s sheltering of terrorists and duplicity at global forums. Earlier, India had rebuked Pak PM Shehbaz Sharif’s UNGA remarks as absurd theatrics and misinformation

title: CBSE launches mental health series; teachers and students to participate
description: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE), in collaboration with AIIMS, will conduct a Virtual Mental Health Series from October 4 to 10, 2025, for principals, teachers, counselors, parents, and students. Aimed at promoting psychological resilience, reducing stigma, and addressing academic stress, the series will feature expert-led sessions covering nutrition, emotional health, digital challenges, and high-risk adolescent behaviour.

Doctors report him stable in cardiac ICU, with a viral fever noted earlier.

description: Dussehra, or Vijayadashami, is a pivotal Hindu festival celebrating the victory of good over evil. It commemorates Lord Rama's triumph over Ravana and Maa Durga's defeat of Mahishasura, symbolizing truth, dharma, and feminine power. Celebrated diversely across India, this auspicious day reminds devotees that righteousness and courage always prevail, inspiring hope and devotion.

He strongly advocated for national self-reliance and strategic diplomacy, urging a critical re-evaluation of current development models.

title: 'Came to kill comedian Munawar Faruqi': 2 Goldy Brar gang members arrested after gunfight
description: Delhi Police arrested two men, Rahul and Sahil, following a shootout in Kalindi Kunj early Thursday. Injured, they are linked to the December 2024 Haryana triple murder case and the Rohit Godara syndicate. Police stated the duo was planning to target a social media influencer, having conducted reconnaissance in Mumbai and Bengaluru. Firearms were seized.

The shutdown costs $400 million daily with no immediate resolution in sight.

'Assault' by actor Dimple: Maid flees Hyderabad flat with torn clothes after incident
description: Actress Dimple Hayathi and her husband David face police charges for allegedly harassing their 22-year-old domestic help. The complainant reported repeated abuse, denial of food, and humiliation. She further alleged David snatched and smashed her phone during an incident. Film Nagar police registered a case under relevant sections of the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, and notices will be served for questioning.

Watch: Israel intercepts boat with Greta onboard; video shows vessels sprayed with water cannons
description: The Israeli navy intercepted a humanitarian flotilla en route to Gaza, detaining activists including Greta Thunberg. Israel claimed the vessels aimed for provocation, not aid, citing a lawful naval blockade. However, the Global Sumud Flotilla condemned the interception as illegal, alleging ramming and communication interference against their peaceful aid mission.

2 kids die from cough syrup in Rajasthan; doc tests it, found unconscious after 8 hrs
description: A Rajasthan doctor collapsed after consuming government-supplied cough syrup, now linked to two child deaths and multiple illnesses. The state has banned 22 batches, recalled existing stock, and launched an inquiry into the widely distributed medicine. Authorities halted supplies from Kayson Pharma, advising against its administration to children under five.

MP: Teacher, wife bury newborn alive over 2-child policy fear; baby survives
description: A government school teacher and his wife in Madhya Pradesh allegedly buried their three-day-old son alive in a forest, fearing job loss under the state's two-child policy. The baby, their fourth child, miraculously survived after villagers rescued him. The couple now faces attempt-to-murder charges, revealing a tragic consequence of the policy and MP's high infant abandonment rates.

21-yr-old YouTube-trained hacker ran piracy syndicate; $100K crypto seized
description: A 21-year-old Patna college dropout, Ashwani Kumar, emerged as a central figure in India's movie piracy network. Using self-taught hacking skills, he breached digital cinema distributors, downloading over 120 unreleased films. Telangana police arrested him, seizing HD prints and freezing $100,000 in crypto. His sophisticated operation, learned from YouTube, exposed major industry cybersecurity flaws, serving as a critical wake-up call.

title: US govt shuts down: Embassy in India gives update; says X account won’t be updated until…
description: The US government has shut down for the first time in nearly seven years, as Republicans and Democrats failed to agree on federal funding. This lapse halts "non-essential" functions like visa services and national parks, while essential employees work without pay. The US Embassy in India also announced reduced updates to its X account.

title: ‘I Love Mohammad’ row: Bareilly seals banquet halls, farmhouses; 600 weddings hit
description: Bareilly authorities sealed seven banquet halls and farmhouses, disrupting hundreds of upcoming weddings. This action followed clashes related to an unauthorized "I Love Muhammad" campaign gathering, with many sealed properties linked to a minority leader. The administration cited illegal construction, leaving affected families scrambling for alternative venues and facing significant problems.

title: US H-1B visa fees hike: Nvidia CEO backs Trump’s ‘reform’; issues talent warning
description: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang endorsed President Trump's H-1B visa reforms but warned the new $100,000 application fee is prohibitively expensive. He cautioned this steep cost could deter global tech talent and students, potentially driving investment away from the US. Huang stressed that attracting the "brightest minds" remains crucial for America's future, despite supporting immigration system overhaul efforts.
